title: Interactive Demonstration Design for Understanding Newton’s Third Law (Action-Reaction Law)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of Newton's fundamental laws of motion and force concepts
context.additional_context: A blended course combining digital device-based experimental simulations with offline interaction demonstrations. Measures conceptual application skills through project-based assessment.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately explain the direction and magnitude of action-reaction forces through interactive demonstration activities
Learners can generate conceptual explanations applying Newton’s Third Law by analyzing everyday cases (pushing, pulling, collisions)
Learners can visualize force interactions and derive data-driven conclusions using digital lab tools
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
